message.content:
cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DM. 

The paper deals with the problem of representing a set as a short bit vector and answering membership queries using non-adaptive bit probes. This problem is related to data structures (cs.DS) and computational complexity (cs.CC). The paper also involves information theory (cs.IT) and cryptography (cs.CR) in the context of designing schemes for the set membership problem. Finally, the paper uses combinatorics (cs.DM) to derive lower bounds on the storage required for the schemes.
